page.title: 08DAILY LIFE OF A MUSLIM BOY
page.content: I wake up at 6.00am on a school day, get dressed and washed in a special way and then perform the{Fajar} (morning prayer). After breakfast I set off for Westborough High School at 8.30am ready for a busy day of lessons. After school I return home, wash, change and have my tea - usually chuppaties and gosht (meat curry). I then perform the{Zohar}(afternoon prayer). At 5.30pm I go to the Mosque where I read the Koran, learn Urdu and perform the{Asar}(evening prayer). From 7.00pm until 9.00pm my time is my own and I use it for homework and playing football with my friends. At 9.45pm I get washed and undressed, perform the{Magrib}(sunset prayer), then drop into bed, tired but looking forward to another day.
